column4: my usb mouse works with the live CD that I installed from, but not when I boot from hdd.  any ideas please?
reboot without inserting the mouse. when desktop comes insert it. if not work poweroff and insert it in and turn on
I booted without mouse in, then inserted it.  it didn't work.  then I booted with the live CD in and the mouse not in, then plugged the mouse in when it was up and it worked.
so the live CD works, and the HDD install doesn't
any ideas how to fix it?
any ideas how to fix it?
no bug let me google
what do you mean, it's not a bug?  I think it must be...
my phone and some of my memory sticks don't work from HDD boot but do from LiveCD boot, too
strange
if you can i suggest you to install ubuntu again
a clean install
a clean install - what do you mean?  that sentence no verb
sorry, I didn't see the previous line
type lsusb in terminal
ok
the mouse is still working
in the live cd or installation?
it works in the live cd and doesn't in the installation
so I'm using the live cd
(actually a live USB stick, but I doubt that's significant)
I'm going to try upgrading the live CD and see if that breaks it like my install is broken
